info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 2 at 4:57PM CDT until August 3 at 12:00PM CDT by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas...
Guadalupe River at Hunt affecting Kerr County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Guadalupe River at Hunt.
* WHEN...Late this afternoon and evening.
* IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water extends into low areas of the flood plain. At 12.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding reaches the Highway 39 bridge floor two miles east of Hunt preventing easy travel to western parts of the county. Areas of the headwaters are isolated temporarily as low water crossings flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:35 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 8.6 feet. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 11.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 05/24/2015. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued Sunday morning by 1100 AM CDT.
